III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Interventions standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff Person 1 choked Youth A.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 06/16/2023. It states Staff Person 1
tugged at Youth A’s arm as he was getting water at the drinking
fountain. Staff Person 1 was then observed putting her hands
around Youth A’s neck and pulled him away. It appeared Staff
Person 1 choked Youth A as she grabbed him by the neck. Youth
A was interviewed and stated that Staff Person 1 put her hand on
the back of his neck. Youth A has no marks or bruising.
I reviewed incident report dated 06/15/2023. It states a staff and a
client witnessed possible abuse of a client by a staff person.
Statements are as follows: Staff Person 1’s statement indicates
residents lining up in the gym and Youth A at the drinking fountain.
Another youth told Youth A to run, and that Staff Person 1 stuck
her arm out to gain control and to prevent Youth A from running.
Staff Person 1 states her knee buckled and that she fell toward
Youth A. Staff Person 2’s statement indicates that Staff Person 1
grabbed Youth A’s arm to pull him away from the drinking fountain
and then placed her hand under his chin/throat and pulled him
away. Staff Person 3’s statement indicates Staff Person 1
directed Youth A away from the drinking fountain by the arm.
I interviewed Complainant/Case Manager onsite on 06/20/2023.
He states Staff Person 2 brought Youth B to him and said that he
had something to say. He reports Youth B and Staff Person 2
reported that they believed Staff Person 1 tugged Youth A by the
arm and pull him by the neck. When Complainant/Case Manger
spoke with Youth A, he denied being choked or pulled away.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 06/20/2023. He states the group
was lining up in the gym to return to the main building and that he
was getting a drink of water from the fountain. He states Staff
Person 1 placed her hand across his shoulder from behind and
said to him that it was time to go and that he walked away. Youth
A denies Staff Person 1 grabbing him in anyway, that she did not
grab him by his neck or throat, and only directed him toward the
line of residents.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 06/20/2023. He states Staff
Person 1 yanked Youth A by the arm and side of neck before
grabbing hold of Youth A by the front of his neck to direct him
away.
2

I interviewed Manager onsite in 06/202/2023. Manager notes
having observed Youth B’s interactions with Staff Person 1 and
states Youth B does not like Staff Person 1 because she is
structured and holds youth accountable for their actions.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 via telephone on 06/21/2023. She
reports previously working for the facility for 16 years and was
rehired in 12/2023. Review of her personnel record indicates she
is up to date with her behavior management training. She reports
the residents were lining up inside the gym to return to the main
building. Youth A was getting a drink of water and that another
resident expressed that he wanted to run from the gym. She
reports placing her hand on Youth A’s shoulder when her knee
buckled and that she slightly lunged downward. Staff Person 1
states that she did not yank Youth A’s arm or grab him by the jaw
or neck as alleged. She states then guiding Youth A back to the
line of other residents.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 via telephone on 06/2/2203. He
reports being employed by the facility for six months. He states
being positioned behind Staff Person 1 and Youth A as he was at
the drinking fountain. He states observing Staff Person 1 have
her hand on the back of Youth A’s arm and that she may have
possibly stumbled. Staff Peron 2 states it looked like Staff Person
1 pulled Youth A by the jaw though states he did not actually
observe Youth A’s throat and bases his observations on Staff
Person 1’s positioning of her wrist and fingers. Staff Person 2
states Youth B was standing with him during the alleged incident.
Additional residents were not interviewed as they were lined up
near the exit and in the opposite direction of where the drinking
fountain was located.
I reviewed video surveillance of the gymnasium dated 06/15/2023
at 3:49PM. It shows a group of residents and staff lining up near
an exit. Staff Person 1 has her arm extended toward Youth A by
the drinking fountain and the group then begins to exit the
gymnasium. A gymnasium hoist is slightly blocking the view. No
outward movement of a struggle is observed.
Analysis There is no evidence to indicate that Staff Person 1 choked Youth
A, or pulled him away by his jaw and arm, nor utilized any form of
behavior management, or was attempting to discipline him in any
manner. It appears Staff Person 1 had her arm extended toward
Youth A while at the drinking fountain to direct him in the direction
of other residents. She reports her knee buckling and that she
3

lunged downward in the direction of Youth A and denies grabbing
or choking Youth A.
Youth A denies being yanked by the arm, being choked or pulled
away by his jaw.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
No change to the current license is recommended.
